div.p: In Daniel Kahneman's book, "Thinking, Fast and Slow", he claims that logic is carried out by 'system 2' ('slow thinking'). Although I suspect that this is probably true for most people, I suspect for a minority of people that logic is carried out by 'system 1' ('fast thinking').

For example: all elite software engineers, I suspect, carry out logic (even complex logic) in 'system 1' ('fast thinking'). I suspect the same may also be true with mathematicians, with their version of complex logic: the mathematical proof. (Sometimes this can be in "one shot" and sometimes in "bursts".)

Perhaps 'system 1' ('fast thinking') logic abilities explain why a small minority of people are attracted to logic basic moral frameworks (ex: libertarianism) or (perhaps) at least partially explains it.
Although, all that is dependent on 'system 1' ('fast thinking') versus 'system 2' ('slow thinking') not being a false dichotomy.
